head.title: U.N. SEES $1 TRILLION IN GLOBAL INVESTMENT

hedline.hl1: U.N. SEES $1 TRILLION IN GLOBAL INVESTMENT

abstract.p: UN Conference on Trade and Development says foreign direct investment worldwide, fueled by cross-border mergers and acquisitions, is expected to increase to $1 trillion this year, up from $865 billion in 1999 (S)

block.p: Foreign direct investment worldwide, fueled by cross-border mergers and acquisitions, is expected to increase to $1 trillion this year, up from $865 billion in 1999, the United Nations trade and development agency said. In its World Investment Report the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development said industrialized economies led by the United States received the largest share of investment inflow, with $276 billion, more than all developing countries combined, at $208 billion.
